variables.name: Dialogue
variables.value: [Character]: Text text text text text text text text text

parameters: "Scientist: Welcome, Codename: Holly. This program will guide you through your virtual training protocols scheduled by Mr. W."
"Scientist: First up, we will evaluate your basic movement capabilities."
"Scientist: Please navigate to the room ahead."
"Scientist: Excellent. Ahead of you, we've placed hurdles to test your vertical agility."
"Scientist: Very good, you've completed the agility course. We will now begin the evaluation of your combat capabilities."
"Scientist: Please head to the area ahead, so we can see how well you fare against other dinosaurs."
"Scientist: Very good. Continue attacking the Procompsognathi. I've added a few more to the simulation for you to fight."
"Scientist: Remember to make contact with blood frequently, so that your body can rapidly regenerate."
"Scientist: Excellent results. As we expected, your abilities are quite adept."
"Scientist: We'd like to see you in action before sending you into the arena, so we're going to put you through another short combat program."
"Scientist: Please continue to the mock-arena simulation."
"Scientist: Excellent showmanship, Codename: Holly. You are ready for the arena."

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for text ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate text to simulate it being written one character at at time (a "typewriter" effect).
description: Animate text to simulate it being written one character at at time (a "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.
- Add the behavior to a Text object (BBText, Bitmap Text object) and choose the interval between characters.
- Change the typing speed with the "Change interval" action.
- Pause the typing and resume it at any time.
- Use the "Skip to end of text" action to give users a way to skip text they don't want to read
- If the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
- Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
- Use a condition to check if a new text character was added. This is useful to trigger audio effects.
- Use the "CurrentCharacter" expression to know when a specific character was displayed.
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Only reload the amount of ammo available

events.name: Reduce heat level (based on cooling rate)

propertyDescriptors.label: Firing cooldown

propertyDescriptors.name: BulletQuantity

propertyDescriptors.label: Rotate bullets to match their trajectory
propertyDescriptors.name: RotateBullet

propertyDescriptors.label: Reloading duration
propertyDescriptors.description: Objects cannot shoot while reloading is in progress
propertyDescriptors.name: ReloadDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Total shots fired
propertyDescriptors.description: Regardless of how many bullets are created, only 1 shot will be counted per frame
propertyDescriptors.name: TotalShotsFired

propertyDescriptors.label: Heat increase per shot (Range: 0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.description: Object is overheated when Heat reaches 1
propertyDescriptors.name: HeatIncreasePerShot

propertyDescriptors.label: Overheat duration
propertyDescriptors.description: Object cannot shoot while overheat duration is active
propertyDescriptors.name: OverheatDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Exponential cooling rate (per second)
propertyDescriptors.description: Happens faster when heat is high and slower when heat is low
propertyDescriptors.name: ExponentialCoolingRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer the bullets are created on
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletLayer

propertyDescriptors.label: Bullet speed variance
propertyDescriptors.description: Bullet speed will be adjusted by a random value within this range
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletSpeedVariance
